resources.string: Failure: This is too early in the morning.
Failure: This is too late at night.
Failure: You missed the moon wide, by leaving to early.
Failure: You missed the moon wide, by leaving to late.
Success! You achieved orbit with the moon!

In this mission you will be expected to pick the exact time and date for a launch of the Saturn V rocket that will put it in orbit around the moon. Assume that the moon has an orbit of exactly 27 days and that at midnight 00:00 it is directly over the launch site. You will need to launch at a time that will put you in the vicinity of the moon 51 hours and 49 minutes later. Can you do it? Don\'t think too hard; it\'s only rocket science.
